knimeNode.name: Pixel Classification Apply
knimeNode.shortDescription: Classifies a feature image with the given pixel classification model.

fullDescription.intro: Classifies a feature image with the given pixel classification model. A feature image is an image of at least three dimension whereof exactly one dimension represents the pixel features, i.e. a vector of numbers describing a pixel. A feature image can be generated by composing outcomes of arbritrary image filter nodes (using the Merger node, for instance) or by using dedicated pixel features nodes (e.g. Fiji Trainable Segmentation Features-node). The feature image should be of the same structure as used to train the pixel classification model.

tab.name: Options
tab.option: Select the dimensions here. The image dimensions and the feature dimension must not be the same and must be present in the selected feature images.
The way the result should be represented. Either the probability maps for each single pixel class is appended, the labeling with each pixel assigned to the most likeli class, or both.

ports.inPort: The feature images whose pixel(-vector) will be classified.
ports.outPort: Probability maps for each single pixel class and/or the pixels labeled with the most likely class.

views.view: View to inspect the result images and labelings in more detail.
